alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Cumberland; Lunenburg; Nottoway; Prince Edward (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 5:46PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Scattered strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Cumberland, Prince Edward, northwestern Lunenburg, western Nottoway and southwestern Amelia Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 545 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking scattered strong thunderstorms over Longwood University, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, pea size hail, and brief heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Rice around 555 PM EDT. Green Bay around 615 PM EDT. Burkeville around 620 PM EDT. Crewe around 625 PM EDT. Nottoway around 645 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Raines Tavern, Tuggle, Prince Edward Station, Angola, Briery, Arvins Store, Twin Lakes State Park, Nutbush, The Falls and Hawk. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Amelia; Cumberland; Lunenburg; Nottoway; Prince Edward
